title: "Power Analysis"

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(brms)
library(broom)
library(ggthemes)

```

```{r}

# setting up the data structure
e_shapes = 10 # number of edgy shapes
r_shapes = 10 # number of round shapes
nr_shape_comb = e_shapes * r_shapes # unique shape combinations
sd_shape_comb = .1 # sd within shapes (from human implicit study)

words = 20 # number of words
sd_words = .7 # sd within words (from human implicit study)

trial_sd = .05  # sd across trials

# simulating the data

sim_d <- function(seed, ntrial) {

#trials = 300 
trials = ntrial 

prop_cor = .5944 # same proportion as humans in second experiment
int = log(prop_cor/(1-prop_cor)) 

#set.seed(1)
set.seed(seed)

err_shape_comb <-tibble(shape_comb = factor(1:nr_shape_comb))%>%
  mutate(err_shape = rnorm(shape_comb, 0, sd_shape_comb))
                                       
err_words <-tibble(word = factor(1:words))%>%
  mutate(err_word = rnorm(words, 0, sd_words))

data <- tibble(trial = 1:trials,
               word = factor(sample(1:words, trials, replace = T)),
               shape_comb = factor(sample(1:nr_shape_comb, trials, replace = T))) %>%
  mutate(resp = rnorm(length(trial), int, trial_sd))%>%
  left_join(err_words)%>%
  left_join(err_shape_comb)%>%
  mutate(resp = resp + err_word + err_shape,
         cor = rbinom(n=length(resp), size=1, prob=exp(resp)/(1+exp(resp))))
}

# fitting the model
# you need to run this once with a single simulated dataset in order to be able to later update the model with additional datasets
# to simualte a single dataset, run the code inside the function above with a specific number for ntrials and seed
fit <-brm(cor ~ 1 + (1 |word) + (1|shape_comb),
          data = data,
          family = bernoulli(),
          control = list(adapt_delta = 0.8),
          seed = 1)


# number of simulations
n_sim <- 100

# simulate multiple data sets and get model results via updating

# takes about 15min to run 
# load one of the next lines to skip
# sim_res <- readRDS("saves/sim_300.rds") # less variation between trials (.05)
# sim_res <- readRDS("saves/sim_300_2.rds") # more variation between trials (.5)
# sim_res <- readRDS("saves/sim_300_3.rds") # sd for word and shape_comb variation based on model for human explicit data
# sim_res <- readRDS("saves/sim_300_4.rds") # sd for word and shape_comb variation based on model for human implicit data

sim <-
  tibble(seed = 1:n_sim) %>% 
  mutate(d    = map(seed, sim_d, ntrial = 300)) %>% 
  mutate(fit  = map2(d, seed, ~update(fit, newdata = .x, seed = .y)))

# extract results and convert intercept and CIs back into proportion space
sim_res <- sim %>% 
  mutate(int = map(fit, tidy, prob = .95)) %>% 
  unnest(int) %>% 
  filter(term == "b_Intercept")%>%
  mutate(estimate = plogis(estimate),
         lower = plogis(lower),
         upper = plogis(upper))

saveRDS(sim_res, "saves/sim_300_4.rds")

```

## plot intercept (in proportion space) across simulations
```{r}
ggplot(sim_res, aes(x = factor(seed), y = estimate, ymin = lower, ymax = upper)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0.5, color = "black", lty = 2) +
  ylim(0,1)+
  geom_pointrange(fatten = 1/2) +
  labs(x = "simulation",
       y = "Proportion correct")+
  theme_few()
```

##  power
```{r}
sim_res %>% 
  mutate(check = ifelse(lower > 0.5, 1, 0)) %>% 
  summarise(power = mean(check))
```
